remarks: No term of a non-zero infinite product is zero.  (Contributed by Scott Fenton, 14-Jan-2018.)
statement:
prodfn0.1 $e |- ( ph -> N e. ( ZZ>= ` M ) ) $.
prodfn0.2 $e |- ( ( ph /\ k e. ( M ... N ) ) -> ( F ` k ) e. CC ) $.
prodfn0.3 $e |- ( ( ph /\ k e. ( M ... N ) ) -> ( F ` k ) =/= 0 ) $.
prodfn0 $p |- ( ph -> ( seq M ( x. , F ) ` N ) =/= 0 ) $.
$d F k $.
$d M k $.
$d N k $.
$d k ph $.
